urls.title: Use less water in the garden: latest RHS research and expert advice / RHS Gardening
urls.description: Learn more from the RHS on managing water in a garden, dealing with drought, waterlogged soils, watering baskets and containers, using grey water and much more

tweets.text:
As we approach the summer months, think carefully about how you use water in the garden if you have one. You might be able to use your water a little more wisely (and possibly save some money at the same time) https://t.co/WbgkdBiIPY
https://t.co/MRLZsYbgwP

#WaterSavingWeek https://t.co/8jz38uElxk

I am committed to making the @envagency a fully equal, diverse and inclusive workplace. 

We are not there yet. But we are on the right path. And we will get there.

Update for my residents in Ravensbury ward and others regarding the  oil spillage investigation in the River Wandle. My officers tell me the investigation was not conclusive; water quality often adversely affected by road runoff after heavy rainfall, according to @EnvAgency.

Pleased to meet the committee of our fantastic B.A.M.E Network this morning.

The past year has been incredibly challenging for our staff from ethnic minority backgrounds. 

The Network has been invaluable supporting  staff and helping to create and roll out our Race Action Plan. https://t.co/dbCHVIa9Fw

urls.title: Walleys Quarry ‚Äì Staffordshire Landfill
urls.description: Walleys Quarry offers customers a safe disposal method for waste that cannot be otherwise re-used or recycled. Our team of experts carefully manage and monitor the site through a set of tight controls and procedures to the highest standards and ensure compliance with all legal and governmental policies and regulations. We work to minimise any impact on the environment now and for the future of the site. The Walleys Quarry community fund has distributed over ¬£1.7m to community and environmental projects
